medical_history.chief_complaint: Complete transection of the common peroneal nerve following right anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with painless common peroneal nerve palsy immediately postoperatively, three months after the operation, with normal lumbar spine MRI results. Neurophysiological studies confirmed a complete lesion of the common peroneal nerve. After nerve repair, nine months later, there was little improvement, and at fifteen months, she displayed normal strength in the hamstrings, but peroneal muscle strength was reduced by 50% compared to the uninjured limb. There was no recovery of nerve function by two years post-injury.
medical_history.social_history: Previously fit and active, worked as a livery manager. No other social factors mentioned.
